text: Francisco Xavier Alarc贸n (February 21, 1954 - January 15, 2016) was an American poet and educator. He was awarded the American Book Award for Snake Poems in 1993. He taught at University of California, Davis. He published over twenty works of poetry between 1985 and 2010. He wrote poetry in English, Spanish and Nahuatl. His works were often translated into other languages including Gaelic and Swedish. == Biography == Alarc贸n was born in Wilmington, Los Angeles, California. He grew up in Guadalajara, Jalisco, Mexico. He studied at Stanford University and California State University, Long Beach. He was openly gay. Alarc贸n died from cancer on January 15, 2016 in Davis, California, aged 61. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== Category:1954 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Educators from Los Angeles Category:American poets Category:Gay men Category:LGBT people from Los Angeles Category:LGBT poets Category:Stanford University alumni Category:People from Guadalajara
